definitions.title: Def
definitions.body: [[קדשׁ]] (√ of foll.; poss. orig. idea of separation, withdrawal (Baud:Studien, ii Nö:LOB Mk 22, Mk 1879, 361 RS:Sem. i. 140; 2nd ed. 150); NH = BH; Ph. [[קדש]] holy, [[מקדש]] sanctuary; As. ḳadâšu II. I, cleanse (Meissn:Suppl. 84), also ḳadištu, hierodule consecrated to Ištar (cf. AJerem:Izdubar 59f.); Ar. qudsun n.pr.mont. (Nö:l. c. RS:Proph. v., N. 9); in Ar. otherwise under infl. of Heb., so Eth.; cf. Targum [[קדשׁ]] in der. spec. and deriv., Syr. qade4 consecrate, etc.; Palm. [[קדש]] id.; Aram. [[קְדָשָׁא]], qdo4o0 (ear- or nose-) ring, (orig. holy thing, Nö:l. c.);—on whole subj. v. Baud Nö RS (reff. above), also HPS:Presb. Rev 1881, 588ff.; diff. fr. [[חרם]] v. GFM:Ju. p. 36).
